The formula is calculating in kilograms.
This formula means that the cost will be calculated in accordance with ($start + (ceil ($weight * 10) - 1) * $step)
where $start - minimum cost of delivery (in the currency delivery).
$step - step cost of delivery (in the currency of delivery)
ceil ($weight * 10) - rounding the expression in parentheses in the up (to the nearest whole number)
For selected currencies should be set their course to the renminbi exchange rates in sub-section.
Perhaps the formula was incorrectly parsed. Recommend the use of her "normal view" editing.
Consider the formula minimum cost delivery (delivery currency)
Consider the formula price step by weight (in the currency of delivery)
Weight is rounded up to a greater whole
If left empty then automatically set to 0, provided that the specified maximum weight
If left empty then automatically set to 999, provided that the specified minimum weight. If both fields (min. and max. Weight) is left blank in the final formula will not be weight restrictions.
If left blank then the step size of the weight will be ignored
Consider the formula initial shipping charges. Tick ​​= Yes.
If you check no cost will depend on the weight of the goods, and will be fixed in the parameter "Initial value".
Rounding weight of the parcel to the nearest larger integer. Tick ​​= Yes.
